crypto.name: janken vs yoshiking
crypto.desc: Yoshiking knows the flag. He will give the flag to who has gold luck. Let's play the janken with Yoshiking and prove your luck!

crypto.name: not mordell primes
crypto.desc:
I found one integral point on an elliptic curve, so there's finite number of integral solutions.
This means You can pick from an finite number of primes... right?
special thanks: https://ctf.cr0wn.uk/challenges#Mordell%20primes-11

crypto.name: pure division
crypto.desc: I'd like to divide! Please help me.

crypto.name: triple aes
crypto.desc: 3-DES is more secure than DES. Then, 3-AES is more secure than AES of course!

crypto.name: warsamup
crypto.desc: Do you know RSA? I know.

pwn.name: gorypto
pwn.desc:
C + AES = crypto
go + AES = gorypto

nc pwn.ctf.zer0pts.com 9003

* The binary is packed with UPX to reduce the size. (This is not important but we notify so that you won't get confused.)

pwn.name: nasm kit
pwn.desc: Let's learn assembly on this platform!

pwn.name: not beginners stack
pwn.desc: Elementary pwners love to overwrite the return address. This time you can't!

pwn.name: oneshot
pwn.desc: And most importantly... you only have one shot.

pwn.name: safe vector
pwn.desc: Even C++ vector is vulnerable to out-of-bound access. I made it secure!

rev.name: Subleq64
rev.desc:
Just run subleq64.sq and it will print the flag for you.

NB: subleq64.sq requires a 64-bit Subleq machine. You can buy one from our sponsors.

rev.name: SuperSecretLogin
infected
rev.desc:
The backdoor is installed on this machine:

How can I use it to get the flag in /root directory?

rev.name: not beginners rev
rev.desc: Writing the "Not Beginner's Stack" challenge, I realized the scheme can also be used for obfuscation.

rev.name: spotlight
rev.desc: You can only see the one lit up by spotlight in the misty forest.

rev.name: syscall 777
rev.desc: Did you know system call number 777 in Linux works as a flag checker?

web.name: guestfs afr
web.desc:
AFR stands for Arbitrary File Read.

Can you read /flag from your workspace?
* The flag for GuestFS:RCE does not exist in this challenge.

web.name: kantan calc
web.desc: "Kantan" means simple or easy in Japanese.

web.name: notpdfgen
web.desc: I've created a pdf generator check it out

web.name: pdfGen
web.desc: I've created a pdf generator check it out

web.name: simple blog
web.desc: Now I am developing a blog service. I'm aware that there is a simple XSS. However, I introduced strong security mechanisms, named Content Security Policy and Trusted Types. So you cannot abuse the vulnerability in any modern browsers, including Firefox, right?
